#!/usr/bin/env bash [[ -f "${TM_SUPPORT_PATH}/lib/bash_init.sh" ]] && . "${TM_SUPPORT_PATH}/lib/bash_init.sh" # View documentation for Latex package # take advantage of the texdoctk index as well as the texdoc catalog directory. . "${TM_SUPPORT_PATH}/lib/html.sh" . "${TM_SUPPORT_PATH}/lib/webpreview.sh" M=${TM_LATEX_MASTER:=$TM_FILEPATH} DIR=`dirname "$M"` FILE=`basename "$M"` TEXDOCTKDB=`kpsewhich --progname=texdoctk --format='other text files' texdoctk.dat` export TEXDOCTKDB TMTEXMAIN=`kpsewhich --expand-path '$TEXMFMAIN'` export TMTEXMAIN # May need to add more lines to accomodate different tex distros. [ -z $TM_LATEX_DOCBASE ] && TM_LATEX_DOCBASE=`kpsewhich --expand-path '$TEXMFDOCDIR'` # TeXLive export TM_LATEX_DOCBASE TM_LATEX_HELP_CATALOG=`find $TMTEXMAIN/../ -name entries -print` export TM_LATEX_HELP_CATALOG TMTEXDOCDIRS=`kpsewhich --expand-path '$TEXDOCS'` export TMTEXDOCDIRS # Switch to the right directory. cd "$TM_PROJECT_DIRECTORY" cd "$DIR" html_header 'Package Documentation' echo '

Hint: Cursor on package name shows doc for package. Otherwise show package doc browser.

' texdoc.py
